questions.question: We will not miss the bus …………………… we start now.
questions.description: If is used to express a condition.

questions.question: ………………………. she mends her ways, she will land in trouble.
questions.description: Unless also expresses a condition. It means if not.

questions.question: I will go to the party …………………………. or not you give me the permission.
questions.description: Whether is preferred in the construction whether...or..

questions.question: …………………………… you do not give me the permission, I will go to the party.
questions.description: Even if refers to the present or future.

questions.question: ………………………….. I will have time I am not sure at the moment.
questions.description: Whether can introduce an indirect question.

questions.question: I believe your story ………………………… others think that you are lying.
questions.description: Although is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: We couldn’t enjoy the picnic ………………………. the rain.
questions.description: Because of is a preposition. It is used before a noun.

questions.question: I couldn’t buy her a nice gift ………………………… I didn’t have enough money.
questions.description: Because expresses the reason for something.

questions.question: ………………………… we finish our work a little early today, we cannot watch the show.
……………………….. she was not there, I spoke to her mother.
questions.description: As can introduce the reason for something.

questions.question: The basket was heavy ……………………….. I could not lift it.
She was sacked ……………………….. she was always late.
